pageContext.claim: “Thank you, President Obama. He gave us 142 Judges. Thank you. Thank you very much, President Obama. We have a record. It's a record and we will appoint many more, but we -- first day I had 142 Judges, 142. I said how many do we have? Sir, you have 142. I said you got to be kidding. I thought he'd say, maybe, none, maybe one, but certainly, no more than one. They're like gold.  They said no, sir, you have 142. I said you've got to be kidding. How did this happen? President Obama, President Obama did not get that done. And by the way, Mitch helped a lot too.”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
